title: Phrack World News
historical_context: This article reflects the hacker culture of the late 1980s, highlighting legal troubles faced by hackers and the community's activities.
target_audience: Hackers, phreakers, security professionals, and those interested in hacker culture history.
short_summary: This issue of Phrack World News covers the legal troubles of notable hackers, including Doc Holiday and The Disk Jockey, as well as announcements related to the hacker community.
summary:
In this edition of Phrack World News, the article recounts the legal troubles faced by two prominent figures in the hacking community: Doc Holiday and The Disk Jockey. Doc Holiday's escapade involved breaking into a telecommunications facility, where he tripped a silent alarm leading to his arrest. His story serves as a cautionary tale about the risks associated with hacking activities, even when they seem harmless. Meanwhile, The Disk Jockey was arrested on multiple counts of fraud, allegedly informed on by a fellow phreaker, White Lightning, highlighting the internal conflicts and betrayals that can occur within the community.

Additionally, the article announces the upcoming SummerCon '88, a convention aimed at bringing together members of the hacking and phreaking communities. It emphasizes the importance of maintaining a legal and educational focus during the event. The piece also mentions the formation of a new group within the hack/phreak community, seeking skilled members, and provides updates on various rumors circulating in the community. Overall, this issue encapsulates the vibrant yet perilous nature of hacker culture during this era.
